Inadequate nutrition: Athletes may not have a well-balanced diet, leading to inadequate energy levels, muscle cramps, or dehydration during the race.
Poor equipment: Participants may not have the appropriate gear, such as a suitable wetsuit, bike, or running shoes, which can impact their performance and safety.
Lack of mental preparation: Athletes may not have adequately prepared mentally for the race, leading to anxiety, fear, or lack of focus during the event.
Inadequate rest and recovery: Participants may not have allowed enough time for rest and recovery between training sessions, leading to overuse injuries or decreased performance.
Inadequate hydration: Athletes may not have adequately hydrated before, during, or after the race, leading to dehydration, cramping, or other health issues.
